title: E-mail address disclosure
overview: <paragraph>Email addresses are typically found on "Contact us" pages, however, they can also be found within scripts or code comments of the application. They are used to provide a legitimate means of contacting an organisation.<paragraph></paragraph>As one of the initial steps in information gathering, cyber-criminals will spider a website and using automated methods collect as many email addresses as possible, that they may then use in a social engineering attack.<paragraph></paragraph>Using the same automated methods, the tool was able to detect one or more email addresses that were stored within the affected page.</paragraph>
remediation: <paragraph>E-mail addresses should be presented in such a way that it is hard to process them automatically.</paragraph>
